page.title: 01Clayton-le-Woods: 1
page.content: The gently undulating{landscape}was formed from glacial deposits and subsequent erosion. Underlying{rocks} outcrop as sandstone in a glacially deposited ridge at Whittle-le-Woods quarries in the East of the block. The{soils}consist of a mixture of clay, sands and gravels being suited to intensive grassland farming of dairy cattle. The area is now part of the{Central {Lancashire New Town}and new housing for sale and for rent is being built in much of the area to the West of the M61 motorway. The area is crossed in a north-south direction by the A6, M61 and the Leeds Liverpool canal which rises through a flight of seven locks at Johnson's Hillock.
